summary: The 'Protect our Public Health Workforce Act' mandates the reinstatement of Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) employees who were terminated without cause between January 20, 2025, and the enactment date. Reinstated employees are eligible for backpay. The bill also requires the CDC Director to submit reports to relevant congressional committees on employee removals, including the number of employees affected, their job titles, and the reasons for their dismissal. Reporting requirements terminate on January 20, 2029.
